item.title: Fence panels damaged and fallen down, 5th September
item.description:
///forget.wipes.bunks I have provided the what3words location as the fence is actually location in the hedge adjacent to the public footpath on the right hand side of the A435 as you approach the roundabout that stems off to Sapphire Road. I couldn't figure out in the App how to put the location unless I used a highlighted path, which is in a different location to the actual broken fence. I hope that makes sense. Sorry

item.title: Replace tree trunk - plant new tree, 4th September
item.description:
Dear Sirs, The works to the junction (cross roads) of Wellington Road and Evesham Road has resulted in the felling of the lovely tree that was there previously (I think it may have been a species of English Willow). All that remains is the trunk. I wondered whether there is an option to replace this with a new tree? Subject to the cost I would be willing to pay for this happy or at the very least to make a financial contribution. I look forward to hearing from you. Kind regards, Alex

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wellington Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 areas of road break up. One deep enough and in a position to potentially present an issue for cyclists, 4th September
item.description:
Two areas of road breaking up over summer on Brooklands Park. Just before the junction of Brooklands Park and Park Avenue, on the left side of road if travelling from Innsworth Lane end of Brooklands. The elongated pot hole is in an area where cycles would be and deep enough to potentially dismount an unwary cyclist.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brooklands Park, Longlevens, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Foot path is missing partway across field to cross railway, 4th September
item.description:
The footpath goes into the field but then doesn’t go anywhere. There should be a crossing across the railway and there was no. In the corner of the field there was another footpath sigh but you can’t get through due to overgrown weeds and trees
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M5, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drains either side of road hump unable to cope with heavy rain. Sep '24 No.17 flooded for the third time because of this issue., 4th September
item.description:
Speed hump opposite No's. 6, 6a and 17. Images show rain water build up after just 20 mins of rain fall today. Drains slow to take water away. Sep '24 under similar rainfall (all be it sustained for an hour+) No.17 flooded into the house due to water build up and overflowing onto driveways. No.15 came close to flooding. Can provide video evidence as supplied to Kathy Williams on her request at time of last occurrence. This has happened 3 times since 2007. Clearing the drain as per "Leaf it out" is not appropriate. These are large deep drains requiring the grate to be lifted. The speed hump acts like a dam. A local builder cleared them at last flooding, using long fence post digging scoops. A large amount of silt, plant debris and beer cans came out. Here's an opportunity to prevent another flood.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brooklands Park, Longlevens, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
